title: What are the best courses after a BSc in nursing? - Quora

response.answer_text: To get good paying job this is one of the best course. But if you want to go for further studies you can do http://M.SC Nursing in this you can do masters in any of the nursing subjects like fundamentals of nsg,community,obs and gynae,medical surgical nursing,oncology,paeds,psychiatry according to your interest.you can do http://m.sc nursing only after getting one year clinical experience. You can get admission in http://m.sc nsg without experience from aiims only through entrance test. Apart from http://m.sc nursing if you want to change your field of nsg you can go for http://m.sc in anatomy,physiology,biochemistry etc from aiims through entrance test. There are some diploma/certificate courses also available for enhancing your skills like diploma in critical care/oncology/emergency/pstchaitry etc. You can also do another post graduation course which do not require subject specification for doing post graduation like psychology,sociology etc.

After the bachelors degree it’s time to go to seminars, workshops, inservice training. Get certified in ACLS. Earn certification in the area you choose to focus your career on. Do this gradually as you proceed through your career. After settling into your chosen specialty then work toward certification or begin a masters degree. Good luck in your career. After retiring from a fifty year career, I can still say it’s the most rewarding thing I’ve ever done.
